pull_request.title: fix(AclFamily): renaming commands and subcommands
pull_request.body:
* Fix renaming ACL commands
* Fix ACL subcommands to be treated as such. For example: ACL list would print all ACL subcommands. Now it only prints ACL
* Add tests

Addresses #2036

pull_request.title: feat(server): perform eviction when used_memory approaches maxmemory in cache mode
pull_request.body:
fixes #1936

This change implements a simple eviction algorithm when used_memory approaches maxmemory when cache_mode is enabled.

We also implement tools for testing the reliability and the performance of the eviction implementation.

issue.title: test_parser_while_script_running fails in debug build
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Assertion fails in: 
```
transaction.cc:297] Check failed: args_[i] == ArgS(args, reverse_index_[i]) (m5 vs. m6)
```

**Reproducible Code Snippet**

Just run locally on debug build: `python3 -m pytest dragonfly/connection_test.py -k "test_parser_while_script_running"`



issue.title: `--tls_ca_cert_dir` doesn't work
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.

Just passing a dir with certificates to this argument does not work in Dragonfly while `--tls_ca_cert_file` works fine
with the same file. I get the following error message

```
Error accepting a client connection: certificate verify failed
````

This seems similar to similar issues in Redis https://github.com/bitnami/charts/issues/8854, https://github.com/redis/redis/issues/7392

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Insert records using `command`
2. Query records using `command`
3. Scroll down to '....'
4. See error

**Expected behavior**
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

Expect it to work as expected or have requirements in the flag help section mentioined.

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: [ubuntu 20.04]
 - Kernel: # Command: `uname -a`
 - Containerized?: [Bare Metal, Docker, Docker Compose, Docker Swarm, Kubernetes, Other]
 - Dragonfly Version: [e.g. 0.3.0]

**Reproducible Code Snippet**
```
# Minimal code snippet to reproduce this bug
```

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

pull_request.title: fix(search): Support indexing array paths
pull_request.body: Fixes one of the issues discussed in #1995 with arrays not being indexed

repo.name: dragonfly

repo.name: dragonfly
repo.description: A modern replacement for Redis and Memcached

comment.body:
This is an UB, I'm afraid. `string_view` must point at a valid range: https://timsong-cpp.github.io/cppwp/string.view.cons
Maybe start with a `vector<pair<size_t, size_t>>` and then convert to `StringList`? I realize it would require another allocation, but it's probably better to not have UB

commits.message:
fix(server): Correctly set expiration from Lua scripts (#2080)

We used to set `time_now_ms_` only in the non-squashed execution path.

Fixes #2034

issue.title: rate-limiter-flexible don't work since 1.11
issue.body:
Probably because of this: https://github.com/animir/node-rate-limiter-flexible/blob/846b5a28987f28e0e13b5ec7965def4aa39a22ab/lib/RateLimiterRedis.js#L4

when I log the .consume response it gives me big msBeforeNext

```
RateLimiterRes {
  _remainingPoints: 4991,
  _msBeforeNext: 281476674260404640,
  _consumedPoints: 9,
  _isFirstInDuration: false
}
```

dragonfly regression or was working before but an issue in the rate-limiter package ?

pull_request.title: fix(server): Correctly set expiration from Lua scripts
pull_request.body:
We used to set `time_now_ms_` only in the non-squashed execution path.

Fixes #2034

<!--
**Commits Must Be Signed and Your PR title must conform to the conventional commit spec**
  * See: https://github.com/dragonflydb/dragonfly/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md
  * Please follow the section on `pre-commit hooks`, a linter will validate before you push

  Example PR Title: <type>(<scope>)!: <description>

  * `type` = bug, chore, feat, fix, docs, build, style, refactor, perf, test
  * `!` = OPTIONAL: signals a breaking change
  * `scope` = Optional when `type` is "chore" or "docs"
  * `description` = short description of the change

Examples:

  * chore(examples): Clarify `docker` usage #120
  * docs(readme): Fix Example Links #121
  * feat(ingest)!: Add new ingest #122
  * fix(ingest): Refactor for loop to list comprehension #123
-->
